results.title: As is
results.creator_credit: Michael Lindsay-Hogg, Iris Merlis, Brandman Productions and Interchange Television Group
results.brief_description: Based on a play by William M. Hoffman, this made for television feature length film was originally produced for Broadway by The Circle Repertory Company and The Glines. Reflective, confronting, compassionate, and experimental in treatment and language “As is” deals up-front with the issue of AIDS in its early days, documenting the different phases from all angles, from the victim through to the lover, the friends, the family and the health carers. Through a montage of scenes, multi-layered, past and present, we witness the story of Rich (Robert Carradine), a Manhattan-based writer who discovers he has a pre-AIDS condition, subsequently finding himself being ostracised by one and all. Alienated and surrounded by fear and paranoia Rich has to mentally come to terms with AIDS and the ignorance which exists amongst the general population, including the medical fraternity, about this new disease. His friend and ex-lover Saul (Jonathan Hadary) is there to support Rich through the emotional stages of fear, anger, denial, cynicism, death vs the will to live, and finally, acceptance. Colleen Dewhurst is outstanding as the hospice worker who through her monologues to the camera tells us what it’s like caring for AIDS patients, her emotional attachments and her anger and frustration with this disease called AIDS. Although acted and directed in a theatrical style, “As is” still is an exceptional film, informative and compassionate, and particularly interesting from an historical viewpoint. Cast also includes Joanna Miles, Allan Scarfe.

results.title: Artisans of Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This video is an intimate view of traditional building and restoration techniques through the eyes of master craftsmen and women. It reveals rare skills which are fast disappearing in this rapidly changing world. The film has six sections each examining an individual craft: timbercraft, stonecraft, glasscraft, ironcraft, solid plastering and decorative paint work.

results.title: Arthur C Clarke presents the colours of infinity
results.creator_credit: Nigel Lesmoir-Gordon, Paul Sinclair and Gordon Films
results.brief_description: The subject of this video is the recent discovery in New York by Dr Benoit Mandelbrot of the Mandelbrot Set. This discovery led to the development of a new mathematical discipline- fractal geometry. Mandelbrot’s discovery was aided by the development of the silicon chip in the 1970’s. It was in the 1980’s, assisted by a super computer at IBN laboratories in New York that Mandelbrot’s startling discovery was made. Author and inventor Dr Arthur C Clarke explores the Mandelbrot Set and fractal world along with fellow colleagues Dr Benoit Mandelbrot, Professor Stephen Hawking, Dr Michael Barnsley and Professor Ian Stewart. Clarke (who wrote the script) postulates on the effect these discoveries will have on the future.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.title: Art since pop
results.brief_description: A general survey of the major developments in US painting and sculpture in the 70’s, following the emergence of Pop Art. Part 1 discusses hard-edge painting, minimalism, shaped canvasses, industrial processes, environmental sculptures and earthworks. It features the work of painters Barnet Newman, Ellsworth Kelly, Mark Rothko, Charles Hinman, Frank Stella and Kenneth Noland, and of sculptors Donald Judd and Christo. Part 2 concentrates on Op art and its interest in illusions of motion, kinetic art, neon and fluorescent art, video art, happenings, holograms and lasers.

results.title: Art for everybody
results.brief_description: The function of an art gallery in the community. Sequences show the variety of interests a gallery can hold for people - exhibitions of great art from many nations, festivals of dancing and music. Even more important is the part a gallery can play in the development of imagination and talent in a child. Through happy participation in painting, modelling activities, costume-making and pageants, children learn about art.

constellations_other.name: Women in charge
constellations_other.description: Across documentary, film, TV, and visual art, Aboriginal women have led how they will be represented on-screen.
